what:
Datasets to Measure the Alignment of Corporate Loan Books with
    Climate Goals
title:
Datasets to Measure the Alignment of Corporate Loan Books with
    Climate Goals
text: datasets support implementation R software PACTA (Paris Agreement Capital Transition Assessment), free tool calculates alignment financial assets climate scenarios (https://www.transitionmonitor.com/). Financial institutions use PACTA study capital allocation impacts climate. financial institutions market data providers keep data private, package provides fake, public data enable development use PACTA R.

title:
Datasets to Measure the Alignment of Corporate Loan Books with
    Climate Goals
text: Install released version r2dii.data CRAN : install development version r2dii.data something like :
code: install.packages("r2dii.data") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("RMI-PACTA/r2dii.data")

title:
Datasets to Measure the Alignment of Corporate Loan Books with
    Climate Goals
code: library(r2dii.data)  head(data_dictionary) #>     dataset               column    typeof #> 1 abcd_demo       abcd_timestamp character #> 2 abcd_demo           company_id character #> 3 abcd_demo  country_of_domicile character #> 4 abcd_demo      emission_factor    double #> 5 abcd_demo emission_factor_unit character #> 6 abcd_demo    is_ultimate_owner   logical #>                                                            definition #> 1         Date at which asset data was sourced from the data provider #> 2 The id of the company owning the asset created by the data provider #> 3                                 Country where company is registered #> 4                     Company level emission factor of the technology #> 5                   The units that the emission factor is measured in #> 6              Flag if company is the ultimate parent in our database

what: An asset-based company dataset for demonstration — abcd_demo
title: An asset-based company dataset for demonstration — abcd_demo
text: Fake data physical assets (e.g. wind turbine power plant capacities), aggregated company-level. data used assess climate alignment financial portfolios. imitates data market-intelligence databases. Demo datasets synthetic financial data strictly private; help demonstrate test implementation R 'PACTA' (https://www.transitionmonitor.com/).

title: An asset-based company dataset for demonstration — abcd_demo
code: abcd_demo

title: An asset-based company dataset for demonstration — abcd_demo
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 4972 rows 14 columns.

title: An asset-based company dataset for demonstration — abcd_demo
text: abcd_timestamp (character): Date asset data sourced data provider., * company_id (character): id company owning asset created data provider., * country_of_domicile (character): Country company registered., * emission_factor (double): Company level emission factor technology., * emission_factor_unit (character): units emission factor measured ., * is_ultimate_owner (logical): Flag company ultimate parent database., * lei (character): legal entity identifier company owning asset., * name_company (character): name company owning asset., * plant_location (character): Country asset located., * production (double): Company level production technology., * production_unit (character): units production measured ., * sector (character): Sector asset belongs., * technology (character): Technology implemented asset., * year (integer): Year production value predicted.

title: An asset-based company dataset for demonstration — abcd_demo
code: head(abcd_demo) #> # A tibble: 6 × 14 #>   company_id name_company          lei   sector technology production_unit  year #>   <chr>      <chr>                 <chr> <chr>  <chr>      <chr>           <int> #> 1 184        Giordano, Giordano e… 2756… power  hydrocap   MW               2020 #> 2 184        Giordano, Giordano e… 2756… power  hydrocap   MW               2021 #> 3 184        Giordano, Giordano e… 2756… power  hydrocap   MW               2022 #> 4 184        Giordano, Giordano e… 2756… power  hydrocap   MW               2023 #> 5 184        Giordano, Giordano e… 2756… power  hydrocap   MW               2024 #> 6 184        Giordano, Giordano e… 2756… power  hydrocap   MW               2025 #> # ℹ 7 more variables: production <dbl>, emission_factor <dbl>, #> #   country_of_domicile <chr>, plant_location <chr>, is_ultimate_owner <lgl>, #> #   abcd_timestamp <chr>, emission_factor_unit <chr>

what: A prepared co2 intensity climate scenario dataset for demonstration — co2_intensity_scenario_demo
title: A prepared co2 intensity climate scenario dataset for demonstration — co2_intensity_scenario_demo
text: Fake co2 intensity climate scenario dataset, prepared software PACTA (Paris Agreement Capital Transition Assessment). imitates climate scenario data (e.g. International Energy Agency (IEA)) including change time production across industrial sectors. Demo datasets synthetic financial data strictly private; help demonstrate test implementation R 'PACTA' (https://www.transitionmonitor.com/).

title: A prepared co2 intensity climate scenario dataset for demonstration — co2_intensity_scenario_demo
code: co2_intensity_scenario_demo

title: A prepared co2 intensity climate scenario dataset for demonstration — co2_intensity_scenario_demo
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 22 rows 7 columns.

title: A prepared co2 intensity climate scenario dataset for demonstration — co2_intensity_scenario_demo
text: emission_factor (double): target sector level emissions factor scenario prescribes., * emission_factor_unit (character): units emissions factor measured ., * region (character): region pathway relevant., * scenario (character): name scenario., * scenario_source (character): source publication scenario taken., * sector (character): sector scenario prescribes pathway., * year (integer): year pathway value prescribed.

title: A prepared co2 intensity climate scenario dataset for demonstration — co2_intensity_scenario_demo
code: head(co2_intensity_scenario_demo) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   scenario_source scenario sector region  year emission_factor_unit              #>   <chr>           <chr>    <chr>  <chr>  <dbl> <chr>                             #> 1 demo_2020       demo     cement global  2020 tonnes of CO2 per tonne of Cement #> 2 demo_2020       demo     cement global  2021 tonnes of CO2 per tonne of Cement #> 3 demo_2020       demo     cement global  2022 tonnes of CO2 per tonne of Cement #> 4 demo_2020       demo     cement global  2023 tonnes of CO2 per tonne of Cement #> 5 demo_2020       demo     cement global  2024 tonnes of CO2 per tonne of Cement #> 6 demo_2020       demo     cement global  2025 tonnes of CO2 per tonne of Cement #> # ℹ 1 more variable: emission_factor <dbl>

title: Dataset to bridge (translate) common sector-classification codes — gics_classification
text: borderline (logical): Flag indicating PACTA sector classification code borderline match. value TRUE indicates match uncertain PACTA sector classification. value FALSE indicates match certainly perfect classification certainly PACTA's scope.., * code (character): Original GICS code., * description (character): Original GICS description., * sector (character): Associated PACTA sector., * version (character): Column identifying GICS version code belongs.

title: Dataset to bridge (translate) common sector-classification codes — gics_classification
text: Classification datasets help standardize sector classification codes wild relevant subset including 'power', 'oil gas', 'coal', 'automotive', 'aviation', 'concrete', 'steel', 'shipping'.

what: Determine if a technology is increasing or decreasing — increasing_or_decreasing
title: Determine if a technology is increasing or decreasing — increasing_or_decreasing
text: dataset provides simple lookup table determine technology meant increase decrease align scenario predicts less 2 degree temperature rise.

title: Determine if a technology is increasing or decreasing — increasing_or_decreasing
code: increasing_or_decreasing

title: Determine if a technology is increasing or decreasing — increasing_or_decreasing
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 20 rows 3 columns.

title: Determine if a technology is increasing or decreasing — increasing_or_decreasing
text: increasing_or_decreasing (character): technology increasing decreasing, defined Paris-aligned IEA scenarios., * sector (character): sector technology belongs., * technology (character): technology sub-category within sector.

title: Determine if a technology is increasing or decreasing — increasing_or_decreasing
code: head(increasing_or_decreasing) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   sector     technology    increasing_or_decreasing #>   <chr>      <chr>         <chr>                    #> 1 automotive electric      increasing               #> 2 automotive hybrid        increasing               #> 3 automotive ice           decreasing               #> 4 automotive fuelcell      increasing               #> 5 power      hydrocap      increasing               #> 6 power      renewablescap increasing

what: A loanbook dataset for demonstration — loanbook_demo
title: A loanbook dataset for demonstration — loanbook_demo
text: Fake financial portfolio. Demo datasets synthetic financial data strictly private; help demonstrate test implementation R 'PACTA' (https://www.transitionmonitor.com/).

title: A loanbook dataset for demonstration — loanbook_demo
code: loanbook_demo

title: A loanbook dataset for demonstration — loanbook_demo
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 283 rows 19 columns.

title: A loanbook dataset for demonstration — loanbook_demo
text: fi_type (character): Financial instrument name asset class., * flag_project_finance_loan (character): Project finance flag denoting whether loan given particular asset ., * id_direct_loantaker (character): Borrower identifier unique borrower/sector combination loanbook., * id_intermediate_parent_n (character): Optional input: id n-th intermediate parent company within company structure can used granular mapping ultimate parent. Smaller values n closer direct_loantaker., * id_loan (character): Unique loan identifier., * id_ultimate_parent (character): Ultimate parent identifier unique ultimate parent/sector combination., * isin_direct_loantaker (logical): Optional input: providing isin identifier direct loan taker improve matching coverage., * lei_direct_loantaker (logical): Optional input: providing lei (legal entity identifier) direct loan taker improve matching coverage., * loan_size_credit_limit (double): Total credit limit exposure default., * loan_size_credit_limit_currency (character): Currency corresponding credit limit., * loan_size_outstanding (double): Amount drawn borrower total credit limit., * loan_size_outstanding_currency (character): Currency corresponding outstandings., * name_direct_loantaker (character): Name company directly taking loan., * name_intermediate_parent_n (character): Optional input: name intermediate parent company within company structure can used granular mapping ultimate parent. Smaller values n closer direct_loantaker., * name_project (logical): Required input loans flag_project_finance_loan = TRUE: Name project financed., * name_ultimate_parent (character): Name ultimate parent company borrower belongs. Can borrower., * sector_classification_direct_loantaker (double): Sector classification code direct loantaker., * sector_classification_input_type (character): Flag identifying sector classification code character description used., * sector_classification_system (character): Name sector classification standard used.

KGaA    NA                       #> 6 L6      C304                Kassulke-Kassulke     NA                       #> # ℹ 15 more variables: name_intermediate_parent_1 <chr>, #> #   id_ultimate_parent <chr>, name_ultimate_parent <chr>, #> #   loan_size_outstanding <dbl>, loan_size_outstanding_currency <chr>, #> #   loan_size_credit_limit <dbl>, loan_size_credit_limit_currency <chr>, #> #   sector_classification_system <chr>, sector_classification_input_type <chr>, #> #   sector_classification_direct_loantaker <chr>, fi_type <chr>, #> #   flag_project_finance_loan <chr>, name_project <chr>, …

what: r2dii.data: Datasets to Measure the Alignment of Corporate Loan Books with Climate Goals — r2dii.data-package
title: r2dii.data: Datasets to Measure the Alignment of Corporate Loan Books with Climate Goals — r2dii.data-package
text: datasets support implementation R software 'PACTA' (Paris Agreement Capital Transition Assessment), free tool calculates alignment corporate lending portfolios climate scenarios (https://www.transitionmonitor.com/). Financial institutions use 'PACTA' study capital allocation decisions align climate change mitigation goals. financial institutions market data providers keep data private, package provides fake, public data enable development use 'PACTA' R.

title: r2dii.data: Datasets to Measure the Alignment of Corporate Loan Books with Climate Goals — r2dii.data-package
text: Maintainer: Alex Axthelm aaxthelm@rmi.org (ORCID) [data contributor] Authors: Jackson Hoffart jackson.hoffart@gmail.com (ORCID) [contractor, data contributor] Mauro Lepore maurolepore@gmail.com (ORCID) [contractor] contributors: Rocky Mountain Institute PACTA4banks@rmi.org [copyright holder, funder]

what: A prepared climate scenario dataset for demonstration — scenario_demo_2020
title: A prepared climate scenario dataset for demonstration — scenario_demo_2020
text: Fake climate scenario dataset, prepared software PACTA (Paris Agreement Capital Transition Assessment). imitates climate scenario data (e.g. International Energy Agency (IEA)) including change time production across industrial sectors. Demo datasets synthetic financial data strictly private; help demonstrate test implementation R 'PACTA' (https://www.transitionmonitor.com/).

title: A prepared climate scenario dataset for demonstration — scenario_demo_2020
code: scenario_demo_2020

title: A prepared climate scenario dataset for demonstration — scenario_demo_2020
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 1512 rows 8 columns.

title: A prepared climate scenario dataset for demonstration — scenario_demo_2020
text: region (character): region pathway relevant., * scenario (character): name scenario., * scenario_source (character): source publication scenario taken., * sector (character): sector scenario prescribes pathway., * smsp (double): Sector market share percentage pathway calculated 2020., * technology (character): technology within sector scenario prescribes pathway., * tmsr (double): Technology market share ratio pathway calculated 2020., * year (integer): year pathway value prescribed.

title: A prepared climate scenario dataset for demonstration — scenario_demo_2020
code: head(scenario_demo_2020) #> # A tibble: 6 × 8 #>   scenario sector     technology region  year  tmsr    smsp scenario_source #>   <chr>    <chr>      <chr>      <chr>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>           #> 1 cps      automotive electric   global  2020  1    0       demo_2020       #> 2 cps      automotive hybrid     global  2020  1    0       demo_2020       #> 3 cps      automotive ice        global  2020  1    0       demo_2020       #> 4 cps      automotive electric   global  2021  1.12 0.00108 demo_2020       #> 5 cps      automotive hybrid     global  2021  1.12 0.0165  demo_2020       #> 6 cps      automotive ice        global  2021  1.02 0.0188  demo_2020

title: r2dii.data 0.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-03-25 loanbook_demo abcd_demo gain sample entries lei_direct_loantaker lei respectively (#349). nace_classification updated version 2.1 (#234). nace_classification gains specific code values distinguish duplicates (#338). isic_classification updated revision 5 (#329). psic_classification gains version column (#344). naics_classification updated version 2022 (#355). gics_classification updated version 2023 (#358). sic_classification aligned 1987 version US SIC codes (#358). Begin deprecation cnb_classification (#329). Complete deprecation ald_demo favor abcd_demo (#328). Complete deprecation green_or_brown favor increasing_or_decreasing (#307).

title: r2dii.data 0.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-11-13 Fix demo data sets. abcd_demo loanbook_demo now use faked company names.

title: r2dii.data 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-10-17 New dataset increasing_or_decreasing supersedes dataset green_or_brown (#307).

title: r2dii.data 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-05 r2dii.data transferred new organization: https://github.com/RMI-PACTA/.

title: r2dii.data 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-05-05 New dataset abcd_demo supersedes dataset ald_demo (#279). region_isos gains data new scenario sources: ‘weo_2021’, ‘etp_2020’, ‘geco_2020’ ‘geco_2021’. region_isos gains country specific regions ‘weo_2019’ ‘weo_2020’ (#270 @julie-vienne).

title: r2dii.data 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-03 region_isos now outputs expected regions : weo_2020 isf_2020 (#253 @Antoine-Lalechere).

title: r2dii.data 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-09 region_isos gains data new scenario sources: weo_2020, isf_2020 nze_2021 (#241 @georgeharris2deg).

title: r2dii.data 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-29 ald_demo scenario_demo_2020 gain rows dummy data hdv (heavy-duty vehicle) sector (#231). ald_demo gains column leiand loses column is_ultimate_listed_owner. Also column id_company becomes company_id ald_emission_factor_unit becomes emission_factor_unit (#233). ald_demo, column id_company now unique name_company sector pair (#232). sector classification datasets, column code now consistently type “character”.

title: r2dii.data 0.1.9
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-01 sector_classifications psic_classification, values sector now lowercase (#222 @daisy-pacheco).

title: r2dii.data 0.1.8
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-22 Remove leading zeroes column code dataset psic_classification (#218 @daisy-pacheco). ald_demo gains column id_company (@vintented #197). nace_classification codes automotive sales now borderline values TRUE (@KapitanKombajn #213).

title: r2dii.data 0.1.7
text: CRAN release: 2021-02-08 Add heavy-duty vehicles green_or_brown, loanbook_demo, ald_demo (@vintented #131). New dataset psic_classification (@daisy-pacheco #199).

title: r2dii.data 0.1.6
text: CRAN release: 2020-12-05 region_isos now correctly maps Kosovo iso “xk” (@cjyetman #186). region_isos now includes missing isos global regions (#183). Add missing sectors nace_classification (@georgeharris2deg #171). Fix borderline definitions isic_classification nace_classification (@georgeharris2deg #163). New dataset cnb_classification (@georgeharris2deg #173).

title: r2dii.data 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-08 Change license CC0; ’s appropriate sharing data (#161). New dataset gics_classification (@georgeharris2deg #162). definition borderline now clearer (@georgeharris2deg #163).

title: r2dii.data 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2020-09-12 Change license MIT. website’s home page now acknowledges funders. website’s home page now reports test coverage. “News” tab website now shows releases date. Replace ‘ton’ ‘tons’ ‘tonne’ ‘tonnes’ (#134). Fix typos columns definitions.

title: r2dii.data 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-04 region_isos longer duplicated rows (@jdhoffa #111). New dataset green_or_brown (#124). New dataset sic_classification (@georgeharris2deg, @daisy-pacheco #125). ald_demo drops column number_of_assets (@tposey28 #121). region_isos gains data ETP 2017 (@jdhoffa #110). Require R >= 3.4, check (@maurolepore #117).

title: r2dii.data 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-06-10 naics_classification now includes 6-digit codes (@QianFeng2020 #102; @jdhoffa #103).

title: r2dii.data 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-06-03 r2dii.data now maturing. naics_classification now includes correct data (@QianFeng2020 #85; @maurolepore #94). region_isos now includes “global” region (@jdhoffa #52). region_isos gains column source updates WEO2019 (@jdhoffa #50). ald_demo gains column ald_emission_factor_unit (#71). New dataset co2_intensity_scenario_demo (@jdhoffa #83). New dataset region_isos_demo (#60). New dataset scenario_demo_2020 (#37).

title: r2dii.data 0.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-25 First release CRAN.
